title: Updated Summoner's Rift Q&A (11/7)
body:
Hey All! We've got members of the team working on the update to Summoner's Rift here to answer your questions. Ask away!

**And that wraps up the Q&A! Thanks for participating and we cannot wait to see you all on the rift! **

replies.body: how many trees are on the new rift?
Depends on if there's a Maokai in the game.
How do the champions arrive on SR? There's no stairs/ helipad/ landing strip/ roads to get there or leave
They port in, one after another, magically. It's actually a nice visual effect!
http://i.imgur.com/96t6I9m.gif
Why isn't there a little splashing effect when walking/running through the river?  I feel that is a small detail that was easily missed.
So this is something we did end up adding during one of the PBE patches. You can now have much fun splash times in river!

I have three questions, one purely curious, one speculative, and one hopeful. =)

- Why is it the the river stops at each lane? Why not let the river... flow like a river across the terrain? They've always been more like long ponds, I feel like this might have been a missed opportunity. =)

- Once the new SR is out and fully available, are we likely to see small changes to the map structure in the future? Things like jungle shape,new/moved brush or river paths?

- Once upon a time, SR had multiple theme'd versions of itself (Harvest, Winter.) Is this something that the team hopes to do again once the new SR is fully launched?

Thanks for all your hard work!
I too would be particularly intersted in seasonal alterations to the rift. Maybe not a complete terraform for each, but surely something to denote the time of year on the map.
Are there any ninja Poro in the new SR?? :O
If there were, how would we know? Ninjas are very good at staying hidden.
What happened to the eternally boiling pot of soup? You're ruining the whole story line!!!
No soup for you!

This is a discussion I started in the pbe and thought it would apply here.

I want other peoples opinion on this idea. What if the whole map heard a dragon rawr when it spawned and whatever sound baron makes when he spawns. i feel that this sound, just like the fear of nocturne or Sion's ultimate, will show the significance of these objectives and make people more inclined to fight over them as well as add some intensity to the game itself.
Will Chris Hansen be incorporated into this map somehow?
Please have a seat. So, what are you doing here?

1.  What is your name?
2.  Why did you change the jungle?
3.  What is the average land speed of a melon laden poro?

1. ManWolf
2. Maps team just made it pretty, you'll have to ask the live design team about season 2015 stuff
3. Is the poro traveling towards the east or the west?
Rito, plz. African or European? {{champion:201}}
This is Runeterra dude. And you ever been to the Howling Abyss? Traveling upwind is no fun.

1. Riot Aeon
2. For the betterment of League of Legends players everywhere!
3. Elevation? Wind speed? Are we allowing the Poro to eat the melon?

{{item:2052}}
When is it going live on teambuilder?
Whats your favorite part of the map?
I like the Gromp. He's adorable in that weird giant gross predatory magic toad sort of way.
The top lane vista. Makes me want to go adventuring.
I personally love the red side fountain turret! Floating laser crystals!
Early on in development, we heard that this new map would be friendlier to older or weaker machines.  Has this ideal been maintained and, if not, what will be the impact on our machines?

We've done a lot of testing on this, and most low spec computers should run faster on the update to Summoner's Rift. Every computer is different, so, while this can't actually be guaranteed, we feel comfortable saying most people will have better frame rate performance now.

With the game becoming more and more complex with new champions and a slew of new mechanics in the upcoming season, why do the jungle camp monsters mirror each other on both sides? It seems like the perfect opportunity to create unique monsters on each side (of course they'd need to be similarly sized, numbered, and have the same stats).

It basically comes down to clarity. For a player who doesn't know what the wolves do, having two different camps, say wolves and dingoes, would raise the question as to whether these monsters have different combat or provide different rewards. Having wolves on each side makes it easy for newer players to recognize that these camps serve the same purpose.
Have you tried having slightly different textures? Like having Red side's golem have more cracks on it than blue side's, because of Baron's influence.
will we see rafiki holding up simba on the new rift?

Hello Riot !

My question:

Is there going to be a different soundscape for each ecosystem of the map? Since you created 4 ecosystems it would also interresting to have a different sound for each ecosystem. 

Otherwise very nice map, I cant wait.

Totally :)

Doing this was actually part of a larger goal that we had to make the map feel more alive. There are some subtle audio variations in the different quadrants that we think will help make those areas feel distinct, alive, and more in-line with the visuals differences you'll seen when exploring them.

in the URF trailer you said that it would be implemented in the  next season, that was in season 4, it is the eve of season 5 and I would very much like it if you put it in.  Don't believe me, look at the video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=misAyNLuoQg
If you look it was Rito games that made the URF promises, this is Riot games, it's easy to confuse them.
Are you guys going to add a spawn point for the minions or indicate where they spawn instead of appearing out of thin air.
We're not going to have anything in for launch, but it's something we're considering doing in the future.

Will champions, that currently are a bit out of style compared to other champions and the new map, get a visual update in the very near future? I can imagine champions like Shaco/Zilean and Taric looking like abominations in a flower meadow...
Yup! Lots of new visual & texture updates for champs have happened and will keep happening to make sure everything plays nice together :)

How is there so much thriving wildlife on SR? With bullets, rockets, arrows, fireballs and random projectiles of desctruction being thrown around at all times, shouldnt the entire place be a barren wasteland?
Life, always finds a way.
If you had to pick one detail of the new Rift as your favorite, what would you pick?
Really really love some of the small animations in the environment. Things like wind over the grass and trees go a long way to making the place feel like a living place to me :)

When approximately will the new rift get released?

What is your opinion on people saying it looks too much like DOTA's map?

Thanks!
I read somewhere there would be new VO lines to the shopkeepers are these still in the works or were they cancelled?

> I read somewhere there would be new VO lines to the shopkeepers are these still in the works or were they cancelled?

VO for the shopkeepers is still something we hope to have in the future.

Oh, here's a good one. Considering everyone calls the respawn point "the fountain" did you try at some point to incorporate actual fountain designs into it? If so, why were these plans changed/dropped? If not, why not?

Will this map have any hidden goodies? 

Example: Old Twisted Treeline, the snakes disappeared when Cassiopeia was on the Map. 
Another: Walking near the pillar in Howling Abyss causes it to crumble.
Don't forget the ghost of urf appearing to deal 1 dmg to ww every time he passed by blue side blue buff area.
